config.question: The Reagan administration pressed on with a goal set by the United States in 1979 despite Soviet protests, European anxiety, and vocal opposition at home and by 1983 had __________.

choices.content: placed cruise missiles in Britain and Germany capable of striking Moscow
eliminated every communist regime in Central America
built military bases in Afghanistan and Iraq in order to “put the squeeze” on Iran
completed construction of the first space station as part of the Strategic Defense Initiative

answer_3.response: Abandoning détente, Reagan implemented a 1979 decision to place 572 Pershing II and cruise missiles in Western Europe within range of Moscow and other Russian cities to match Soviet deployment of medium-range missiles aimed at NATO countries. Despite Soviet protests, uneasiness in Europe, and a vocal opposition at home, the United States began putting the weapons in Britain and Germany in 1983.
